reviews.text: The room was adequate but very hot - no air conditioning. It appears there has been a management decision to remove the welcome file from rooms so you have to ask reception about using Phone, TV, and for the WI Fi code! Why? Neither guests nor reception seemed to think it sensible!
reviews.title: What a Pity
Fantastic girlie break!!
reviews.text: Food was adequate but service slow. Our table was forgotten for a while. It was the cost of drinks that I found totally unacceptable. No House Wine on the list and my husband ordered a Rose. The most expensive at about £29 was brought in a cooler and the chitty left on the table. We had ordered the only other choice at nearly £25. We noticed so I sent it back and had water. What a pity!

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff
reviews.text: We stayed Saturday night on the lunch, dinner bed and breakfast, and spa treatment rate and we had a fantastic time. We were a party of 12 girls and everything from the very attentive staff to our lovely lunch on arrival was first class. The treatments received were very enjoyable and relaxing. The pool was very welcoming on such a hot day. Our rooms were lovely and well equipped and it was no trouble for housekeeping to add extra beds to some rooms to avoid sharing beds! Our evening meal was most enjoyable and again restaurant were e cellent. All in all it was a lovely relaxing stay I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. I will definately be back.

reviews.title: Staff couldn't do enough. Excellent service!!
reviews.text: We stayed here at the weekend as a final relaxing break before our twins arrive!

The staff were fantastic right from the start, we arrived far earlier than the check in time but were found a room which wasn't far from reception so that I didn't have to waddle far! The room was well equipped and little extras we asked for (like extra pillows) were delivered to the room very promptly. The only down side is that there is no air con in the rooms but there was a portable unit which was very effective.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for an Event

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here on the spa weekend deal on 13th July. I don't normally write reviews but on this occasion I felt the urge to! It was brilliant! The food we had was top quality, fresh and tasty, the treatments were so relaxing and professional, the whole place was spotlessly clean, I'm a bathroom freak and there wasn't a single hair to be found :-). Above all the staff were amazing, always smiling and going out of their way to ask if you needed anything. Not just one of them, all of them, we all found this so refreshing. I will also say how hard they worked and looked like long hours but still they were cheerful and friendly. Thankyou.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay would highly recommend!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay here in a couple of months, the first time was not a great success which was unusual as we have stayed at Q Hotels many times before and always found them to be excellent, the main problem was with the restaurant, the service was erratic with a really long wait between courses, one main course was not hot and we were not very impressed with the choices for vegetarians pasta or risotto, not very inspiring. I brought up our disappointment with reception when we checked out, I then sent an email when we got home. We had a reply very quickly acknowledging that there was a problem with the restaurant on the night we ate, we were offered an upgrade to a Q Star room if we returned, so we thought we would try again & have just returned having had a much better stay. Our room was a good size & the bed very comfortable, with a Q Star room you get a few extras, alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks in the fridge, better quality tea & coffee & a free newspaper, we had to sleep with the window open as the weather was warm & there was some traffic noise from the main road. we decided not to eat in the main restaurant this time having a bar meal instead which we enjoyed. Breakfast was very good, can recommend the cooked to order omelets which were delicious. All the staff were very friendly & polite with nothing being too much trouble. Stratford town centre is 10mins away with free on street parking after 6pm if you want venture out in the evening. I am pleased we gave Stratford Manor a second chance as we really enjoyed our stay, I think you can't fault Q Hotels on customer service, if things do go wrong they do try their best to make up for it, we are looking forward to our next stay in a Q Hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent Saturday and Sunday night here, a great base from which to explore all that Stratford and the surrounding area have to offer. Polite and welcoming receptionists, quick and easy check in-the addition of a pool and spa helps you to really relax and unwind. Beautiful grounds, a lovely patio area and tennis courts for the more active guests. Standard room was good and had everything you would expect in a four star hotel. The weather was exceptionally warm while we were there so having a large fan in the room was a welcome addition. Breakfasts were excellent-lots of choices. Staff were all pleasant and courteous. We had a really lovely stay.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.text: A group of eight family and friends spent a delightful and happy time celebrating our sister's 50th birthday. The staff were all very welcoming, polite and helpful. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. Lunch, dinner and breakfast were served with the minimum of fuss but staff were quite attentive and always there when required. The food was cooked well, looked attractive and was sufficient. Our one negative comment was that our sunday lunch pannini did not have near enough goats cheese in it. However, I did not raise this comment at the time with the staff and so cannot complain. We had such a good relaxing time and would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: spa week-end

reviews.text: We have just had a wonderful weekend at the hotel. We had 4 rooms and all 8 of us were very pleased with the bedrooms. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. We had wonderful food over the break and found that the staff in the hotel were polite and friendly and very helpful. We had fabulous weather and very much enjoyed the time on the veranda out side the spa where we spend a lot of our time. Special thanks to Linda the new beautician for giving excellent beauty treatment. Great Hotel.
reviews.title: 50th Birthday Spa weekend

reviews.text: My husband treated me to an over night spa deal at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great spa weekend

reviews.text: The staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. I enjoyed using the small gym and swimming pool. The spa treatments were great, just what I needed, delivered by friendly staff. The food was good. Overall, it was a great hotel and the staff and treatments offered made it a relaxing treat. I would definitely use the hotel for a spa package again.
reviews.title: Fantastic spa weekend!

reviews.text: I took a group of 11 friends for a spa weekend for a relaxing hen party. The service, food, accomodation, and general experience was fantastic! Staff were all friendly and eager to make our weekend special. The spa treatments were amazing and great value for money. I would reccommend this hotel and spa facilities to anyone, couples or groups. Thank you all so much!
reviews.title: Girlie weekend

reviews.text: just returned from a spa weekend highly recommended the staff were excellent could not do enough for you, rooms were spotless and the facilities were perfect, Food was lovely and very well presented. Would return there as the weekend was very enjoyable and good value for money.
reviews.title: Summer Ball Venue

reviews.text: Our school Summer Ball was held at the Stratford Manor hotel in June this year, and from start to finish, the service and attention received from the staff at Stratford Manor was first class. They definitely put the customer first in every sense. The food was excellent, and the function room one of the best I have used. Well done to a top class team!
reviews.title: good service, corporate premises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a short drive to the main town centre and is both easy to find and access. We booked it specifically as it was "Pet Friendly" (£15 was quoted, but this was not added to our bill on checkout), and there were many patrons with well-behaved dogs in residence. The grounds are lovely for walking the dog, but we couldn't find a dedicated "poop bin", which, for a dog-friendly hotel seemed a little unusual.
reviews.title: Excellent, pet friendly luxury

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and spacious...they are looking a little worn at the edges, but are nonetheless comfortable and pleasant to relax in. The fitness centre has mainly cardio equipment and a few free weights, and the pool is big enough for a workout.
reviews.title: Wonderful spa break I would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent - a buffet with a range of cooked and cold selections. The staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Flatters to deceive

reviews.text: Overall it was good value for money and we would be happy to return, with our dog.
reviews.title: Lovely weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value overnight break with a group of friends including room, lunch, dinner and breakfast with 2 spa treatments and use of pool, sauna and steam room with a complimentary bottle of pink fizz in the room. We had wonderful service and treatment every step of the way. Every single member of staff we encountered was friendly and courteous. Spa treatments were carried out the the utmost professionalism and care, leaving us feeling very relaxed. All the meals were very, very nice and well served and presented and of a high standard.the room was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Spoiled by the heat
